info.name: Salesforce Data Cloud APIs
info.description:
This is a collection of requests for the Salesforce Data Cloud APIs (also known as Direct APIs):
Profile API
Query API
Calculated Insights API
Metadata API
Ingestion API
Data Graph API
Use Data Cloud APIs to query metadata and data from Data Cloud. Apart from the Ingestion API, the Data Cloud APIs are read-only and are generally faster than their [Connect API](https://www.postman.com/salesforce-developers/workspace/salesforce-developers/collection/12721794-fa94cb66-3cb1-41e1-ad4b-7c0ec34bb430) counterparts. **Note:** If you need CRUD access to Data Cloud resources, use the [Salesforce Data Cloud Connect APIs](https://www.postman.com/salesforce-developers/salesforce-developers/collection/wgh5wpn/salesforce-data-cloud-connect-apis). Data Cloud APIs require a special two-step authentication: 1. Authentication against the Salesforce Platform. In this collection, we use OAuth for simplicity but you can also use other OAuth flows or JWT authorization. See [Getting Started](https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.c360a_api.meta/c360a_api/c360a_getting_started_with_cdp.htm) in the Data Cloud Reference Guide. 2. Authentication against the Data Cloud tenant. **⚠️ Disclaimers:** - This collection is provided as-is. It's not officially supported by Salesforce or covered by SLAs. - API documentation is not provided with the collection. Please refer to the [official documentation](https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.c360a_api.meta/c360a_api/c360a_api_quick_start.htm). ## Get Started **Note:** Watch the [Data Cloud APIs and Postman Quick Start Video](https://salesforce.vidyard.com/watch/ryF2yRi6gctEwUdVkLQvdP) to learn how to authenticate with the Data Cloud APIs collection and make API calls. 1. Fork the collection using this button: [](https://god.gw.postman.com/run-collection/14448118-8145476a-1797-4b2a-b219-37c6d438d956?action=collection%2Ffork&source=rip_markdown&collection-url=entityId%3D14448118-8145476a-1797-4b2a-b219-37c6d438d956%26entityType%3Dcollection%26workspaceId%3D34382471-0c97-40e5-a206-f947271665c4) 2. Select the root folder of your forked collection. 3. Go the the **Authorization** tab. 4. Scroll down and click **Get New Access Token**. 5. When prompted to do so, log in to your Salesforce org and allow access. 6. Click **Use Token**. 7. Open the **Auth > Complete Postman authentication** request. 8. Click **Send**. ## Variables Reference The collection relies on the following variables: | Variable | Description | | --- | --- | | `loginUrl` | For production, use `login.salesforce.com`
For sandboxes, use `test.salesforce.com` | | `version` | Salesforce API version number | | `clientId` | Consumer key from the Connected App. Leave the default value to benefit from the shared Connected App. | Variables prefixed with an underscore (`_`) are reserved for internal use (scripts) and should not be edited manually. | Variable | Description | | --- | --- | | `_dcTenantUrl` | URL of the Data Cloud tenant. | | `_dcTenantToken` | Authentication token for the Data Cloud tenant. | | `_jobId` | Job ID shared across Ingestion Bulk API requests. |

item.name: Auth

exec: throw new Error('Request failed: response content type is not JSON.');
// Extract core auth token from request
throw new Error(`Couldn't retrieve Authorization header from response.`);
// Extract core instance URL from response
// Prepare and send tenant auth request
console.log('Sending request to authenticate against Data Cloud tenant');

request.description: **⚠️ Postman hack:** this request is actually **not** part of the Data Cloud API. It's a hack that lets us quickly retrieve the Data Cloud tenant access token thanks to post-request scripts.

item.description: Custom request that converts the Salesforce access token to a Data Cloud access token via a script. It saves the Data Cloud access token and URL in the collection's variables.

item.name: Metadata API

request.description:
The Metadata API response includes metadata about all entities, including Calculated Insights, Engagement, Profile, and other entities, as well as their relationships to other objects.

[https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.c360a_api.meta/c360a_api/c360a_api_metadata_api.htm](https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.c360a_api.meta/c360a_api/c360a_api_metadata_api.htm)

request.description:
The response includes metadata about the data cloud object type supplied in the query parameters.

[https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.c360a_api.meta/c360a_api/c360a_api_metadata_api.htm](https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.c360a_api.meta/c360a_api/c360a_api_metadata_api.htm)

item.description: Data Cloud Metadata API response includes metadata about all entities, including Calculated Insights, Engagement, Profile, and other entities, and their relationships to other objects. For data lake objects (DLOs) and data model objects (DMOs), the API response also includes information about key qualifier fields. For each DLO field and DMO field, the API response includes the name of the associated key qualifier field.

exec: throw new Error('Missing Data Cloud tenant token. Make sure to authenticate with both Salesforce and the DC tenant.');

item.description:
Query Data Cloud data including data streams, profile or engagement data model objects (DMOs), and unified DMOs.

The Query API V1 supports SQL query in ANSI standard. The SQL can be a free form SQL with objects that include data streams, profile or engagement data model objects, and unified data model objects. The Query API V1 supports only synchronous calls. You can use the API to support a variety of use cases that include data extraction, external application integration or interactive querying on the data lake. If you don't want to fetch the entire data like in case of browser-based clients then you can make a call to the API with limits.

exec: throw new Error('Missing Data Cloud tenant token. Make sure to authenticate with both Salesforce and the DC tenant.');

item.description:
Query Data Cloud data including data streams, profile or engagement data model objects (DMOs), and unified DMOs. Query API V2 is optimized for large-volume data queries.

The initial POST request returns data along with the batch ID for the next batch. Retrieve the next batch of records using the batch ID.

item.description:
Query Data Cloud data including data streams, profile or engagement data model objects (DMOs), and unified DMOs. Query API V2 is optimized for large-volume data queries.

The initial POST request returns data along with the batch ID for the next batch. Retrieve the next batch of records using the batch ID.
